uprigth.advice: Frustration, impatience, lack of progress in love.
uprigth.description: The reversed Seven of Pentacles suggests feelings of frustration or impatience with the progress of your relationship. You may be questioning whether your efforts are worth it or if things are moving too slowly. This card advises you to avoid making hasty decisions or giving up prematurely. Relationships take time to develop, and patience is key to seeing the fruits of your labor.

name: Eight of Pentacles (Card 8 in the Pentacles)

uprigth.keywords: Diligence, skill development, mastery, hard work, craftsmanship.
uprigth.advice: Stay focused on perfecting your skills and putting in the necessary effort. Mastery comes with consistent dedication and attention to detail.
uprigth.description: The Eight of Pentacles is all about hard work, craftsmanship, and skill-building. You are committed to mastering your craft or refining your skills, whether in your career or personal endeavors. This card encourages a diligent, disciplined approach to your work, knowing that the effort you put in now will pay off in the future. It may also indicate a time of study or practice to develop new competencies. Stay dedicated, pay attention to details, and continue honing your abilities to achieve success.

reversed.keywords: Lack of focus, laziness, poor quality work, shortcuts, burnout.
reversed.advice: Take time to refocus your energy on what matters most. Avoid cutting corners or rushing your work, as it may compromise the quality of the results.
reversed.description: The Eight of Pentacles reversed suggests a lack of focus or commitment to your work. You might be feeling unmotivated or burned out, leading to poor quality or rushed efforts. This card is a warning against taking shortcuts or sacrificing attention to detail in the pursuit of quick results. Alternatively, it may indicate that you need to revisit your priorities and make sure you’re working on something that genuinely aligns with your goals. Take time to rest and reenergize if burnout is affecting your productivity.

uprigth.keywords: Dedication, hard work, building a strong relationship.
uprigth.advice: Continue putting in the effort to nurture and strengthen your relationship.
uprigth.description: The Eight of Pentacles represents dedication and hard work in love. It suggests that you and your partner are actively working to build a strong and lasting relationship. This card encourages you to keep putting in the effort, as your commitment will lead to a fulfilling and stable connection. For singles, it indicates that focusing on personal growth and self-improvement will attract a meaningful relationship.

reversed.keywords: Lack of effort, neglect, stagnation in love.
reversed.advice: Address any lack of effort or neglect in your relationship to prevent stagnation.
reversed.description: The reversed Eight of Pentacles warns of a lack of effort or neglect in your relationship. One or both partners may not be putting in the necessary work to maintain the connection, leading to stagnation. This card advises you to identify the areas where more attention is needed and to renew your commitment to the relationship.

name: Nine of Pentacles (Card 9 in the Pentacles)

uprigth.keywords: Abundance, luxury, self-sufficiency, independence, success.
uprigth.advice: Celebrate your achievements and enjoy the fruits of your labor. You’ve worked hard for your success, and it’s time to appreciate your independence.
uprigth.description: The Nine of Pentacles represents personal success, abundance, and independence. You’ve put in the hard work, and now you’re reaping the rewards. This card symbolizes a sense of accomplishment, financial security, and the ability to enjoy the finer things in life. It’s also about self-sufficiency—knowing that you’ve achieved your goals through your own efforts. Whether in career, finances, or personal growth, this is a time to celebrate your achievements and take pride in your success.

reversed.keywords: Financial setbacks, dependence, overindulgence, superficial success.
reversed.advice: Reflect on whether you are truly enjoying the fruits of your labor or if your focus has shifted to materialism. Be cautious about financial risks.
reversed.description: The Nine of Pentacles reversed can indicate setbacks in financial matters or a loss of independence. You might be relying too heavily on others for support, or you may feel that your success is superficial, focused more on appearances than genuine fulfillment. It also warns against overindulgence—be careful not to spend recklessly or become too focused on luxury and material wealth. This card urges you to reevaluate your priorities and focus on what brings true, lasting satisfaction.

uprigth.keywords: Independence, self-sufficiency, confidence, enjoying love.
uprigth.advice: Embrace your independence and confidence within your relationship or as a single individual.
uprigth.description: The Nine of Pentacles represents independence and self-sufficiency in love. If you're in a relationship, this card encourages you to maintain your sense of individuality and confidence while enjoying the stability and abundance you have built together. It signifies a healthy balance between being committed and valuing personal freedom. For singles, it highlights the importance of self-love and confidence before entering a relationship. You are in a place of self-reliance, and this will attract a partner who respects and appreciates your independence.

reversed.keywords: Overdependence, lack of confidence, isolation in love.
reversed.advice: Work on building your self-confidence and avoid becoming overly dependent on your partner.
reversed.description: The reversed Nine of Pentacles warns of overdependence or a lack of self-confidence in love. You may be relying too much on your partner for emotional or financial support, leading to an imbalance in the relationship. This card advises you to focus on building your independence and self-worth to restore harmony. For singles, it may suggest feelings of isolation or insecurity, and it encourages you to work on self-love before pursuing a new relationship

name: Ten of Pentacles (Card 10 in the Pentacles)

uprigth.keywords: Wealth, family, legacy, long-term success, inheritance, security.
uprigth.advice: Focus on building a secure and lasting foundation for the future. It’s a time to think about your legacy and the long-term impact of your actions.
uprigth.description: The Ten of Pentacles represents long-term financial security, stability, and the accumulation of wealth or resources. It is often associated with family, legacy, and the passing down of wealth through generations. This card signifies that your hard work and investments are paying off, providing a sense of security and success not just for yourself, but for those around you. Whether it’s in financial matters or family life, you are creating a strong foundation for future generations to thrive. Now is the time to think about what legacy you want to leave behind.

reversed.keywords: Financial loss, instability, family disputes, short-term focus.
reversed.advice: Be mindful of long-term financial planning, and avoid making decisions based on short-term gains. Address any family conflicts that could disrupt stability.
reversed.description: The Ten of Pentacles reversed suggests instability in financial or family matters. There could be issues with inheritance, family disputes, or the loss of wealth. It warns against focusing too much on short-term gains at the expense of long-term security. This card advises you to think carefully about the future and ensure that you are building a stable foundation. It may also indicate conflicts within the family that need resolution to restore harmony and security.

uprigth.keywords: Long-term stability, commitment, family, legacy.
uprigth.advice: Focus on building a long-term, stable relationship that provides emotional and material security.
uprigth.description: The Ten of Pentacles represents long-term commitment, stability, and the creation of a lasting legacy in love. It signifies a relationship built on a strong foundation of trust, support, and shared values. You and your partner are working towards a secure future together, possibly including family, home, or financial stability. This card encourages you to focus on building a legacy of love and abundance that will stand the test of time. For singles, it indicates the potential for a long-term, committed relationship on the horizon.

reversed.keywords: Instability, lack of commitment, family or financial strain.
reversed.advice: Address any instability in your relationship and work towards rebuilding trust and security.
reversed.description: The reversed Ten of Pentacles may indicate instability or a lack of long-term commitment in your relationship. Family or financial issues may be causing strain, leading to feelings of insecurity. This card advises you to work together with your partner to address these concerns and focus on rebuilding trust and stability. For singles, it may suggest that you are hesitant about long-term commitment, and it encourages you to reflect on your desires for the future.

name: Page of Pentacles (Card 11 in the Pentacles)

uprigth.keywords: Opportunity, ambition, new venture, manifestation, study.
uprigth.advice: Focus on learning and seizing opportunities for growth. Stay grounded and practical in your approach to new ventures or goals.
uprigth.description: The Page of Pentacles symbolizes new opportunities, especially in the material realm, such as career, finances, or education. This card represents ambition and the desire to learn and grow. It often signals the start of a new venture—whether it's a job, investment, or project—that has great potential for long-term success. The Page encourages a practical and diligent approach to your goals, reminding you to stay grounded and focused on the details. It’s also a card of study and learning, suggesting that you may need to gather more knowledge or skills to achieve your aims.

reversed.keywords: Lack of focus, missed opportunities, immaturity, laziness.
reversed.advice: Avoid getting distracted or losing sight of your goals. Be careful not to waste opportunities due to lack of preparation or commitment.
reversed.description: The Page of Pentacles reversed indicates a lack of focus or ambition. You might be missing opportunities because of distractions or failing to take the necessary steps toward your goals. It can also suggest immaturity or laziness—perhaps you're not taking your responsibilities seriously enough, or you're relying too heavily on others to do the work. This card advises you to refocus your energy, make a plan, and commit to the effort needed for success. Avoid shortcuts, and take the time to build a solid foundation.

uprigth.keywords: New opportunities, curiosity, learning in love.
uprigth.advice: Stay open to learning and growing within your relationship, and approach love with curiosity.
uprigth.description: The Page of Pentacles represents new opportunities and the desire to learn and grow in love. This card suggests that you or your partner may be exploring new ways to strengthen your relationship, approaching it with curiosity and an open mind. It encourages you to remain focused on building a solid foundation while embracing the lessons that love has to offer. For singles, it signifies the potential for a new relationship that will provide opportunities for personal growth.

reversed.keywords: Lack of focus, immaturity, missed opportunities in love.
reversed.advice: Address any lack of focus or immaturity in your relationship to prevent missed opportunities for growth.
reversed.description: The reversed Page of Pentacles warns of a lack of focus or immaturity in love. You or your partner may not be fully committed to the growth of the relationship, leading to missed opportunities. This card advises you to take a more grounded approach to love, focusing on the long-term potential rather than short-term distractions. For singles, it may suggest that you are not yet ready for a serious relationship, and it encourages you to work on personal growth before pursuing love.

name: Knight of Pentacles (Card 12 in the Pentacles)

uprigth.keywords: Diligence, responsibility, hard work, routine, reliability.
uprigth.advice: Stay committed to your work and responsibilities. Slow and steady progress is key to achieving your goals.
uprigth.description: The Knight of Pentacles is a card of hard work, diligence, and reliability. This Knight is methodical and disciplined, preferring to take a practical approach to life. He values routine, responsibility, and steady progress, even if it means moving slowly. This card represents persistence and dedication in pursuing long-term goals. In work or financial matters, the Knight encourages you to stay focused on the task at hand and be patient as you work toward success. Trust that your consistent efforts will pay off in time, even if the results aren't immediate.

reversed.keywords: Stubbornness, laziness, routine without progress, workaholism.
reversed.advice: Reevaluate your approach to ensure you're making meaningful progress. Avoid being overly stubborn or rigid in your methods.
reversed.description: The Knight of Pentacles reversed suggests stagnation or a lack of progress despite consistent effort. You may feel stuck in a routine that isn’t leading to tangible results. This card warns against being too rigid in your approach—while discipline is important, flexibility and adaptability are also crucial for growth. Alternatively, the reversed Knight can indicate laziness or reluctance to take action, suggesting that you may need to get moving and focus on your goals. It can also warn of workaholism, where you’re overly focused on work to the detriment of other areas of your life.

uprigth.keywords: Loyalty, patience, responsibility, steady progress in love.
uprigth.advice: Approach your relationship with patience, loyalty, and a focus on steady progress.
uprigth.description: The Knight of Pentacles represents loyalty, responsibility, and steady progress in love. This card suggests that you or your partner are committed to building a lasting relationship through patience and dedication. It encourages you to remain focused on the long-term, understanding that true love takes time to grow. For singles, it indicates that a loyal and dependable partner may be entering your life, bringing stability and commitment.

reversed.keywords: Stubbornness, stagnation, lack of excitement in love.
reversed.advice: Address any stagnation in your relationship and find ways to reignite passion and excitement.
reversed.description: The reversed Knight of Pentacles warns of stubbornness or stagnation in your relationship. You or your partner may be too focused on routine, leading to a lack of excitement and growth. This card advises you to shake things up and find ways to bring passion and spontaneity back into your relationship. For singles, it may suggest that you are too set in your ways, preventing you from being open to new romantic opportunities.

name: Queen of Pentacles (Card 13 in the Pentacles)

uprigth.keywords: Nurturing, practicality, security, abundance, domesticity.
uprigth.advice: Take a balanced approach to your responsibilities, focusing on both your career and home life. You have the ability to nurture those around you while building security for yourself.
uprigth.description: The Queen of Pentacles embodies abundance, practicality, and nurturing energy. She is grounded, responsible, and capable of creating both financial security and a comfortable home environment. This card represents a balance between work and home life, suggesting that you can take care of both your professional responsibilities and the people you love. The Queen encourages you to be practical and sensible in your approach to achieving success, reminding you that a nurturing, caring attitude will help create lasting stability and abundance. She also advises you to take care of your own well-being while supporting others.

reversed.keywords: Self-care neglect, financial instability, imbalance, overextension.
reversed.advice: Focus on taking care of yourself first, especially if you've been overextending your energy on others. Work on restoring balance in your life.
reversed.description: The Queen of Pentacles reversed can indicate a lack of balance between your personal and professional life. You might be neglecting self-care or feeling overwhelmed by your responsibilities. This card warns against spreading yourself too thin—whether in your career, finances, or home life—at the cost of your well-being. It’s important to restore balance and focus on self-care to maintain your stability. Financially, this card can indicate instability or mismanagement of resources, advising you to reassess your approach to managing money and creating security.

uprigth.keywords: Nurturing, security, generosity, stability in love.
uprigth.advice: Focus on providing emotional and material security in your relationship, and nurture your connection.
uprigth.description: The Queen of Pentacles represents nurturing, stability, and generosity in love. She encourages you to provide a secure and supportive environment for your relationship to flourish. This card suggests that you or your partner are deeply caring and focused on creating a comfortable, abundant life together. It also highlights the importance of balancing love, family, and material concerns to maintain harmony. For singles, it indicates that you are in a nurturing and stable place, ready to attract a meaningful relationship.

reversed.keywords: Overdependence, insecurity, neglect in love.
reversed.advice: Address any insecurities or neglect in your relationship, and focus on nurturing yourself and your partner.
reversed.description: The reversed Queen of Pentacles warns of overdependence or insecurity in love. You or your partner may be feeling neglected or lacking the emotional support needed for the relationship to thrive. This card advises you to address these issues by nurturing both yourself and your partner, focusing on creating a secure and supportive dynamic. For singles, it may suggest that you need to focus on self-care and building your confidence before seeking a relationship.

name: King of Pentacles (Card 14 in the Pentacles)

uprigth.keywords: Wealth, security, discipline, leadership, success.
uprigth.advice: Focus on building long-term security and stability. Your discipline and hard work will lead to material success and leadership.
uprigth.description: The King of Pentacles represents wealth, financial security, and material success. He is a disciplined, responsible leader who has achieved his goals through hard work and determination. This card symbolizes the pinnacle of financial stability and the ability to provide for yourself and others. It suggests that you have the ability to lead with wisdom and authority, whether in business, finances, or personal matters. The King encourages you to focus on building a stable foundation and making smart, strategic decisions to maintain your success. This is a card of prosperity and long-term security.

reversed.keywords: Greed, financial mismanagement, rigidity, materialism.
reversed.advice: Be cautious about becoming overly focused on wealth or material success. Reevaluate your priorities and avoid letting greed or rigidity control your decisions.
reversed.description: The King of Pentacles reversed warns of greed, materialism, or financial mismanagement. You may be too focused on wealth, leading to an imbalance in other areas of your life. This card suggests that your desire for success or control may be driving you to make decisions that are not in your best interest. It advises you to reevaluate your priorities and avoid becoming too rigid or obsessed with material outcomes. Financially, it can signal poor management of resources or the risk of instability due to irresponsible behavior.

uprigth.keywords: Stability, loyalty, success, long-term commitment in love.
uprigth.advice: Embrace stability and loyalty in your relationship, and work towards long-term success.
uprigth.description: The King of Pentacles represents stability, loyalty, and success in love. This card suggests that you or your partner are deeply committed to building a secure and lasting relationship. The King of Pentacles values loyalty and long-term stability, encouraging you to focus on creating a strong foundation for your future together. For singles, it indicates the potential for a serious and successful relationship with someone who is grounded, reliable, and devoted.

reversed.keywords: Materialism, stubbornness, control issues in love.
reversed.advice: Avoid letting material concerns or control issues disrupt the emotional connection in your relationship.
reversed.description: The reversed King of Pentacles warns of materialism or control issues in love. You or your partner may be overly focused on financial or external factors, neglecting the emotional aspect of the relationship. This card advises you to re-evaluate your priorities and focus on building a strong emotional connection. It also suggests addressing any stubbornness or controlling behavior that may be causing tension.

name: Ace of Swords (Card 1 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Clarity, breakthrough, new ideas, truth, justice.
uprigth.advice: Use your intellect to cut through confusion and find clarity. This is a time for decisive action and honest communication.
uprigth.description: The Ace of Swords represents new ideas, breakthroughs, and mental clarity. It signifies the emergence of a powerful insight or truth that cuts through confusion and brings a new perspective. This card can indicate the beginning of a challenging but ultimately rewarding mental journey, where you are called to use your intellect, logic, and reason to solve problems and make decisions. The Ace of Swords encourages clear communication, fairness, and truth. It’s a reminder to embrace honesty and justice, even if the truth may be difficult to accept.

reversed.keywords: Confusion, miscommunication, clouded judgment, dishonesty.
reversed.advice: Take a step back to reassess the situation. Be wary of unclear communication or clouded judgment.
reversed.description: The Ace of Swords reversed suggests confusion, miscommunication, or a lack of clarity. You may be struggling to find the truth in a situation, or your judgment may be clouded by emotions or external influences. This card advises you to pause and reflect before making any decisions, as your current perspective may be skewed. It also warns of dishonesty or the withholding of information, urging you to seek the truth and ensure that communication is clear and honest.

uprigth.keywords: Clarity, truth, new perspective, communication.
uprigth.advice: Speak your truth and seek clarity in your relationship. Clear communication is key to resolving any issues.
uprigth.description: The Ace of Swords represents clarity and truth in relationships. It encourages open and honest communication, which can lead to breakthroughs and deeper understanding between partners. This card suggests that you are gaining a new perspective on your relationship, allowing you to cut through confusion and get to the heart of any issues. For singles, it can indicate a new beginning based on honesty and mutual understanding, or meeting someone with whom you can have clear and direct communication.

reversed.keywords: Miscommunication, confusion, lack of clarity.
reversed.advice: Avoid jumping to conclusions, and take time to clarify misunderstandings before they escalate.
reversed.description: The reversed Ace of Swords warns of miscommunication or confusion in love. You or your partner may be struggling to express your thoughts and feelings clearly, leading to misunderstandings. This card advises you to slow down and focus on improving communication. For singles, it may indicate uncertainty or a lack of clarity about a potential partner’s intentions, and it encourages you to seek more information before moving forward.

name: Two of Swords (Card 2 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Indecision, stalemate, choices, blocked emotions.
uprigth.advice: Trust your intuition to make a difficult decision. Don’t avoid the issue—facing it head-on will bring resolution.
uprigth.description: The Two of Swords represents a difficult decision or a stalemate where no clear solution is apparent. It can suggest that you are avoiding a situation or refusing to acknowledge the truth because it’s too painful or challenging. This card encourages you to confront your choices and trust your intuition to guide you toward the right path. It’s a reminder that while the decision may be difficult, avoiding it will only prolong the discomfort. The Two of Swords also reflects blocked emotions, suggesting that you may need to open up and address your feelings in order to move forward.

reversed.keywords: Indecision, confusion, emotional detachment, avoidance.
reversed.advice: Take time to gather more information before making a decision. Be careful not to let avoidance lead to stagnation.
reversed.description: The Two of Swords reversed indicates ongoing indecision or confusion. You may feel stuck because you don’t have all the information needed to make a choice, or you may be avoiding a difficult truth. This card advises you to seek clarity and make a decision rather than continuing to avoid the issue. Emotional detachment may be hindering your ability to see the situation clearly, so it’s important to address your feelings and communicate openly. Don’t let indecision paralyze you—taking even a small step forward can help break the stalemate.

uprigth.keywords: Indecision, stalemate, emotional barriers, avoidance.
uprigth.advice: Face your emotional challenges head-on and make a decision, even if it’s difficult.
uprigth.description: The Two of Swords suggests indecision or avoidance in your love life. You or your partner may be at a stalemate, unable or unwilling to confront important emotional issues. This card represents a need to make a decision or take action, even if it feels uncomfortable. Avoiding the problem will only lead to further stagnation. For singles, it may indicate that you are unsure about how to move forward in a potential relationship, and it encourages you to take time to reflect and find clarity.

reversed.keywords: Decision made, emotional release, no longer avoiding.
reversed.advice: It’s time to release the emotional barriers and move forward with a decision, bringing clarity and resolution.
reversed.description: The reversed Two of Swords suggests that you or your partner are ready to move beyond indecision and take action. You may have been avoiding a difficult conversation or emotional confrontation, but now you are prepared to face it. This card signifies the release of tension and the possibility of a fresh start. For singles, it can indicate that you are overcoming emotional barriers that have been preventing you from pursuing new love.

name: Three of Swords (Card 3 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Heartbreak, sorrow, grief, betrayal, emotional pain.
uprigth.advice: Allow yourself to feel the pain, but don’t let it consume you. Healing comes through acknowledgment and release.
uprigth.description: The Three of Swords is a card of heartbreak, sorrow, and emotional pain. It often appears in readings when a relationship has ended, trust has been broken, or deep emotional wounds are present. This card encourages you to acknowledge your pain and allow yourself to grieve, but also to remember that healing is possible. It may be a difficult time, but the Three of Swords reminds you that through this experience, you can gain greater emotional strength and clarity. Although the pain is real, it will eventually pass, and you will emerge stronger for having faced it.

reversed.keywords: Recovery, healing, releasing pain, forgiveness.
reversed.advice: Focus on healing and letting go of past hurts. Be open to forgiveness and emotional recovery.
reversed.description: The Three of Swords reversed signals the beginning of healing and recovery after a period of emotional pain or heartbreak. You may be starting to let go of the hurt and finding ways to forgive, either yourself or others. This card encourages you to release lingering bitterness or resentment and embrace the process of emotional healing. It’s a sign that you are ready to move forward, even if the pain is still fresh. With time and self-compassion, you can find peace and emotional renewal.

uprigth.keywords: Heartbreak, betrayal, emotional pain, separation.
uprigth.advice: Allow yourself to feel and heal from emotional pain, and take time to recover before moving forward.
uprigth.description: The Three of Swords is a card of emotional pain, heartbreak, and betrayal in love. It suggests that you or your partner may be experiencing sorrow due to a breakup, argument, or unfaithfulness. This card acknowledges the deep hurt but also reminds you that healing is possible with time. For singles, it may indicate lingering emotional wounds from past relationships that need to be addressed before you can move forward in love.

reversed.keywords: Healing, forgiveness, emotional recovery.
reversed.advice: Focus on healing and forgiving, either yourself or others, and allow the past wounds to heal.
reversed.description: The reversed Three of Swords signifies the beginning of emotional healing after a period of pain. You or your partner may be in the process of recovering from heartbreak, and this card encourages forgiveness and moving forward with a lighter heart. For singles, it suggests that you are finally letting go of past pain and are ready to open yourself up to new love.

name: Four of Swords (Card 4 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Rest, recovery, solitude, contemplation, healing.
uprigth.advice: Take time to rest and recharge. Quiet contemplation will bring clarity and healing.
uprigth.description: The Four of Swords indicates a period of rest and recovery, often after a time of stress or difficulty. It suggests that you need to take a step back and give yourself space to heal, both physically and mentally. This card encourages solitude and quiet reflection, allowing you to regain your strength and clarity. It’s a time to pause and recuperate before taking on new challenges. The Four of Swords reminds you that self-care is essential, and taking a break can lead to a renewed sense of purpose and direction.

reversed.keywords: Restlessness, burnout, stress, avoidance of rest.
reversed.advice: Make time for rest and recovery, even if you feel too busy. Burnout is a risk if you ignore the need for self-care.
reversed.description: The Four of Swords reversed suggests that you may be pushing yourself too hard and are in danger of burnout. You might be feeling restless or stressed, unable to find the time to rest and recharge. This card advises you to prioritize your well-being, even if it means taking a break from your usual responsibilities. Avoidance of rest can lead to physical and emotional exhaustion, so it’s important to listen to your body and mind and allow yourself the space to heal. Recognize the need for recovery before it becomes a more serious issue.

uprigth.keywords: Rest, recovery, contemplation, taking a break.
uprigth.advice: Take time to rest and reflect on your relationship. A period of introspection can lead to renewed clarity and understanding.
uprigth.description: The Four of Swords indicates a need for rest and contemplation in love. You or your partner may be going through a period of withdrawal to reflect on your relationship and personal needs. This card suggests that taking a step back from emotional intensity can provide the space needed to heal and recharge. For singles, it may indicate a time of solitude to reflect on past relationships and prepare for future ones.

reversed.keywords: Burnout, stagnation, lack of rest.
reversed.advice: Avoid pushing yourself or your relationship too hard without taking time to reflect and recharge.
reversed.description: The reversed Four of Swords warns of burnout or stagnation in love. You or your partner may be pushing too hard without taking the time needed for introspection and rest. This card encourages you to slow down and allow yourself to recover before trying to solve relationship issues. For singles, it may suggest that you are feeling exhausted by the pursuit of love, and it’s time to take a break and focus on yourself.

name: Five of Swords (Card 5 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Conflict, defeat, dishonor, betrayal, tension.
uprigth.advice: Avoid engaging in unnecessary conflicts. Sometimes it’s better to walk away than to win at any cost.
uprigth.description: The Five of Swords indicates conflict and tension. It often represents a situation where there’s a sense of dishonor or betrayal, either by others or yourself. This card can suggest that you’ve been involved in a disagreement where winning has come at a cost, perhaps damaging relationships or integrity. The Five of Swords urges caution in how you approach challenges—sometimes victory isn’t worth the price, and it may be better to step back or avoid further conflict. It also signals the need to reflect on how your actions affect others and whether personal gain is worth the damage it may cause.

reversed.keywords: Reconciliation, resolution, compromise, forgiveness.
reversed.advice: Seek peace and reconciliation. It’s time to put conflict behind you and move forward with a spirit of compromise.
reversed.description: The Five of Swords reversed suggests a desire for reconciliation and resolution after a period of conflict. You may be ready to forgive and move forward, putting the tension and discord behind you. This card encourages healing, both in relationships and within yourself, allowing for a more peaceful resolution to past conflicts. It’s a sign that you’ve learned from the experience and are now prepared to compromise or make amends. The reversed Five of Swords emphasizes that it’s time to release any lingering resentment and focus on rebuilding trust and harmony.

uprigth.keywords: Conflict, tension, winning at all costs, unfairness.
uprigth.advice: Be mindful of how you approach conflict in your relationship, and avoid using manipulative or hurtful tactics to 'win.'
uprigth.description: The Five of Swords represents conflict and tension in love. You or your partner may be engaging in power struggles or manipulative behavior to win an argument or get your way. This card warns that such tactics can lead to emotional harm and a breakdown of trust. It encourages you to approach disagreements with fairness and respect for each other’s feelings. For singles, it may indicate that unresolved conflicts from the past are affecting your ability to move forward in love.

reversed.keywords: Resolution, peace, reconciliation.
reversed.advice: Seek to resolve conflicts with compassion and forgiveness. Focus on reconciliation rather than winning.
reversed.description: The reversed Five of Swords indicates that you or your partner are ready to move past conflicts and seek resolution. This card suggests that reconciliation is possible if both parties are willing to let go of ego and approach the situation with compassion. For singles, it may indicate that you are finally finding peace after a period of emotional tension or conflict, and you are ready to embrace love with a fresh perspective.

name: Six of Swords (Card 6 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Transition, moving on, healing, relief, recovery.
uprigth.advice: Embrace change and transition. Moving away from difficulties will lead to a more peaceful situation.
uprigth.description: The Six of Swords represents a transition from difficulty to peace. It often signifies a period of healing or recovery after hardship, and the card suggests that while the journey may not be easy, you are heading toward a better place. This card encourages you to leave behind past challenges and embrace the changes that are necessary for your growth and well-being. The Six of Swords can also represent physical or emotional travel, such as moving away from a toxic situation or taking time to heal from a loss. While the process of leaving may feel bittersweet, it is ultimately for the better.

reversed.keywords: Stagnation, difficulty moving on, unresolved issues, resistance to change.
reversed.advice: Let go of the past and allow healing to take place. Holding on to old wounds will only prolong the pain.
reversed.description: The Six of Swords reversed suggests difficulty moving on from past hardships. You may be clinging to old wounds or resisting the changes that are necessary for your growth. This card urges you to confront the unresolved issues that are holding you back and preventing you from finding peace. It’s a reminder that healing can only occur when you let go of the past and embrace the changes ahead. The reversed Six of Swords also indicates stagnation or being stuck in a difficult situation, and it encourages you to take steps toward finding resolution, even if it means facing uncomfortable truths.

uprigth.keywords: Transition, moving on, healing, relief, recovery.
uprigth.advice: Embrace change and transition. Moving away from difficulties will lead to a more peaceful situation.
uprigth.description: The Six of Swords represents a transition from difficulty to peace. It often signifies a period of healing or recovery after hardship, and the card suggests that while the journey may not be easy, you are heading toward a better place. This card encourages you to leave behind past challenges and embrace the changes that are necessary for your growth and well-being. The Six of Swords can also represent physical or emotional travel, such as moving away from a toxic situation or taking time to heal from a loss. While the process of leaving may feel bittersweet, it is ultimately for the better.

reversed.keywords: Stagnation, difficulty moving on, unresolved issues, resistance to change.
reversed.advice: Let go of the past and allow healing to take place. Holding on to old wounds will only prolong the pain.
reversed.description: The reversed Six of Swords suggests difficulty moving on from past hardships. You may be clinging to old wounds or resisting the changes that are necessary for your growth. This card urges you to confront the unresolved issues that are holding you back and preventing you from finding peace. It’s a reminder that healing can only occur when you let go of the past and embrace the changes ahead. The reversed Six of Swords also indicates stagnation or being stuck in a difficult situation, and it encourages you to take steps toward finding resolution, even if it means facing uncomfortable truths.

name: Seven of Swords (Card 7 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Deception, betrayal, strategy, sneaky behavior, escape.
uprigth.advice: Be cautious and aware of dishonesty or manipulation. Sometimes subtle strategies are needed, but avoid deceit.
uprigth.description: The Seven of Swords represents deception, betrayal, or cunning strategies. It often appears when someone is being dishonest, either with others or themselves. This card suggests that something may be happening behind the scenes, and it encourages vigilance and caution. Alternatively, it may signify a need to use strategy and stealth to navigate a tricky situation. The Seven of Swords advises you to be careful with your actions and motives, as dishonesty or manipulation could lead to unintended consequences. It also warns against sneaky or underhanded tactics in your dealings with others.

reversed.keywords: Guilt, regret, coming clean, self-deception.
reversed.advice: It’s time to come clean or face the consequences of dishonesty. Acknowledge the truth, even if it’s difficult.
reversed.description: The Seven of Swords reversed suggests that deceit or betrayal may be coming to light. You may be feeling guilty or regretful about past actions, and this card encourages you to come clean and make amends. It also warns against self-deception or denial, advising you to face the truth of a situation rather than continuing to hide or avoid it. The reversed Seven of Swords can also indicate that someone in your life is being dishonest, and it encourages you to seek clarity and honesty in all your interactions. Now is the time for transparency and integrity.

uprigth.keywords: Deception, betrayal, sneakiness, strategy.
uprigth.advice: Be cautious of deceit in your relationship. Trust your instincts and address any feelings of betrayal or dishonesty.
uprigth.description: The Seven of Swords is a card of deception and hidden actions. In love, it suggests that either you or your partner may be hiding something or acting in a less-than-honest way. This card warns of dishonesty, betrayal, or a lack of trust in the relationship. It encourages you to confront any suspicions or doubts directly, rather than allowing them to fester. For singles, it can indicate that someone new may not be entirely truthful, and you should approach new romantic interests with caution.

reversed.keywords: Confession, honesty, coming clean.
reversed.advice: It's time to confront the truth and clear up any misunderstandings or deceit. Be open and honest, even if it's uncomfortable.
reversed.description: The reversed Seven of Swords indicates that deceit or dishonesty is being brought to light. Either you or your partner may be ready to confess or come clean about something that has been hidden. This card encourages honesty and transparency, even if the truth is painful. For singles, it suggests that you are ready to let go of deceptive behavior or dishonesty in your romantic pursuits, and you are seeking a more genuine connection.

name: Eight of Swords (Card 8 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Restriction, limitation, feeling trapped, self-imposed imprisonment.
uprigth.advice: You have the power to free yourself from limitations. Look at the situation from a new perspective to find solutions.
uprigth.description: The Eight of Swords represents feeling trapped or restricted, often by your own thoughts or beliefs. This card suggests that you may be holding yourself back, convinced that there’s no way out of a difficult situation. However, the restrictions you feel are often self-imposed, and the Eight of Swords encourages you to look at the situation from a different perspective. You have more power and control than you realize, and by shifting your mindset, you can find a way to break free. The card reminds you that sometimes the only thing keeping you stuck is your own fear or doubt.

reversed.keywords: Liberation, empowerment, breaking free, overcoming fear.
reversed.advice: Take steps to free yourself from limiting beliefs or situations. You are stronger than you realize.
reversed.description: The Eight of Swords reversed signifies liberation and breaking free from self-imposed limitations. You may be realizing that the restrictions you felt were largely a result of your own fear or negative thinking, and now you are ready to take control and find your way out. This card encourages empowerment and a renewed sense of freedom, as you recognize your own strength and ability to overcome obstacles. It’s a sign that you are ready to let go of the fears or doubts that have been holding you back and take decisive action to move forward.

uprigth.keywords: Restriction, feeling trapped, helplessness, confusion.
uprigth.advice: Don’t let fear or self-doubt hold you back in your relationship. Break free from limiting beliefs.
uprigth.description: The Eight of Swords represents feeling trapped or restricted in your love life. You or your partner may feel stuck in a situation that seems difficult to escape, but this card suggests that much of the restriction is self-imposed. It indicates that fear, insecurity, or self-doubt is preventing you from seeing a way out. This card encourages you to take a step back and realize that you have more power to change your situation than you think. For singles, it may indicate that limiting beliefs or fears of rejection are holding you back from pursuing new love.

reversed.keywords: Liberation, empowerment, seeing a way forward.
reversed.advice: Break free from mental limitations and allow yourself to explore new possibilities in love.
reversed.description: The reversed Eight of Swords signifies that you are ready to break free from the limitations and restrictions that have been holding you back in love. You are gaining clarity and realizing that you have the power to change your circumstances. This card encourages you to let go of fear and take control of your love life. For singles, it suggests that you are overcoming fears and self-doubt, and are ready to open yourself up to new romantic opportunities.

name: Nine of Swords (Card 9 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Anxiety, worry, fear, nightmares, guilt.
uprigth.advice: Acknowledge your fears and anxieties, but don't let them overwhelm you. Seek support and face your worries directly.
uprigth.description: The Nine of Swords is a card of anxiety, fear, and mental anguish. It often represents sleepless nights and worry about the future, leaving you feeling overwhelmed and powerless. This card suggests that you may be experiencing guilt, fear, or doubt, which is taking a toll on your emotional and mental well-being. It encourages you to face your fears head-on, as continuing to avoid or suppress them will only make them grow. While the challenges you face may be daunting, the Nine of Swords reminds you that much of your distress is based on perception, and things may not be as dire as they seem.

reversed.keywords: Relief, recovery, facing fears, overcoming anxiety.
reversed.advice: You are beginning to overcome your anxieties and fears. Stay focused on healing and release any lingering doubts.
reversed.description: The Nine of Swords reversed suggests that you are starting to overcome your fears and worries. After a period of intense anxiety or emotional turmoil, you are beginning to find relief and healing. This card encourages you to continue facing your fears and challenges, as the worst is now behind you. The reversal also indicates that you may have been able to put your anxieties into perspective, realizing that they were more a product of your mind than reality. This is a time of recovery, where you are releasing the burdens that have weighed on your heart and mind.

uprigth.keywords: Anxiety, worry, sleepless nights, fear.
uprigth.advice: Address the underlying worries in your relationship. Don’t let fear and anxiety control your actions.
uprigth.description: The Nine of Swords represents deep anxiety and fear in love. You or your partner may be experiencing sleepless nights and overthinking the relationship, leading to emotional distress. This card suggests that there is a heavy emotional burden being carried, and it encourages you to confront these fears directly. Ignoring them will only lead to further anxiety. For singles, it may indicate that fears of rejection or past trauma are causing undue worry about finding love, and this is preventing you from moving forward.

reversed.keywords: Release of fear, overcoming anxiety, mental clarity.
reversed.advice: Let go of overwhelming worries and focus on healing. Relief is on the way.
reversed.description: The reversed Nine of Swords indicates that you are beginning to overcome the fears and anxieties that have been plaguing your love life. You are gaining clarity and releasing the emotional burdens that have been weighing you down. This card encourages you to seek support, either from a partner or loved ones, to help you through this process. For singles, it suggests that you are finally letting go of past fears and are ready to embrace love with a clearer mind.

name: Ten of Swords (Card 10 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Betrayal, endings, rock bottom, painful loss, crisis.
uprigth.advice: Accept that some situations must come to an end. Release the past, and focus on healing and moving forward.
uprigth.description: The Ten of Swords signifies the end of a difficult or painful situation. It often indicates a sense of betrayal, loss, or reaching rock bottom. This card suggests that while you may have experienced a deep wound or emotional crisis, it marks the conclusion of this chapter. The Ten of Swords encourages you to accept the finality of the situation and to release the pain, allowing yourself to heal and move on. Though the card represents a painful ending, it also holds the promise of renewal and the opportunity to rebuild once you’ve let go of the past.

reversed.keywords: Recovery, regeneration, healing from pain, survival.
reversed.advice: You are recovering from a challenging period. Focus on rebuilding and finding strength in your resilience.
reversed.description: The Ten of Swords reversed indicates that you are beginning to recover from a difficult situation. After a period of intense pain or emotional suffering, you are now moving towards healing and regeneration. This card suggests that you are starting to release the burdens and wounds of the past, finding a way to rebuild and move forward. The reversal also symbolizes survival, showing that despite the challenges you’ve faced, you have the strength to rise again. The worst is behind you, and it’s time to focus on healing and renewal.

uprigth.keywords: Betrayal, painful ending, collapse, defeat.
uprigth.advice: Accept the painful end of a cycle in your relationship. It may be time to let go and move forward.
uprigth.description: The Ten of Swords signifies a painful and possibly final ending in love. You or your partner may be going through a period of betrayal, heartbreak, or collapse, and this card represents the emotional devastation that comes with it. It acknowledges the deep pain but also suggests that the worst is now over, and healing can begin. This card encourages you to accept that some relationships must end for new opportunities to arise. For singles, it may indicate the need to fully release past heartbreak before moving forward in love.

reversed.keywords: Recovery, healing, survival, new beginnings.
reversed.advice: Allow yourself to heal and rebuild after a painful experience. The worst is behind you, and a new chapter awaits.
reversed.description: The reversed Ten of Swords suggests that you are in the process of recovering from a painful relationship or breakup. The emotional storm is passing, and you are beginning to heal and regain your strength. This card encourages you to focus on the future and the new possibilities that lie ahead. For singles, it suggests that you are ready to let go of past wounds and start fresh in love, with a greater sense of emotional resilience.

name: Page of Swords (Card 11 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Curiosity, intelligence, communication, new ideas, restlessness.
uprigth.advice: Be open to learning and gathering new information. Use your intellect to analyze situations and communicate clearly.
uprigth.description: The Page of Swords represents curiosity, new ideas, and a thirst for knowledge. This card often appears when you are eager to learn or embark on a new intellectual pursuit. The Page of Swords encourages you to stay alert and open to new information, as well as to communicate your thoughts and ideas clearly. It can also represent a person in your life who embodies these traits—someone sharp, inquisitive, and full of energy. This card suggests that while you may be new to a situation, you have the mental agility to navigate it successfully by staying observant and open-minded.

reversed.keywords: Gossip, misinformation, defensiveness, scattered thoughts.
reversed.advice: Be careful of rumors or misinformation. Take the time to organize your thoughts and communicate with care.
reversed.description: The Page of Swords reversed warns of potential misunderstandings, gossip, or miscommunication. You may be feeling scattered or overwhelmed by information, making it difficult to focus or make decisions. This card advises you to take a step back and organize your thoughts before acting or speaking. Be mindful of how you communicate, as defensiveness or impulsiveness could lead to conflicts. Additionally, the reversal may suggest that someone around you is spreading misinformation or gossip, so it’s important to verify facts before jumping to conclusions.

uprigth.keywords: Curiosity, communication, mental agility, new ideas.
uprigth.advice: Keep communication open and honest. Approach new love with curiosity and be willing to learn.
uprigth.description: The Page of Swords represents curiosity and communication in love. You or your partner may be eager to learn more about each other or explore new ideas within the relationship. This card suggests that mental agility and open communication are key to building a strong connection. For singles, it indicates that you may meet someone who stimulates your mind and encourages intellectual exploration in love.

reversed.keywords: Gossip, defensiveness, miscommunication.
reversed.advice: Avoid unnecessary arguments and misunderstandings. Stay calm and address issues with clarity and patience.
reversed.description: The reversed Page of Swords warns of miscommunication or defensiveness in love. You or your partner may be quick to jump to conclusions, leading to unnecessary arguments. This card encourages you to slow down and approach conversations with patience and clarity. For singles, it suggests that you may encounter someone who is not being entirely truthful, or you may be prone to gossip or assumptions that create misunderstandings in love.

name: Knight of Swords (Card 12 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Ambition, determination, focus, swift action, impulsiveness.
uprigth.advice: Move forward with determination and focus, but be mindful of impulsive actions. Think things through before rushing in.
uprigth.description: The Knight of Swords is a card of action, ambition, and swift movement. This card suggests that you are driven by a strong sense of purpose and are ready to charge ahead to achieve your goals. While the Knight of Swords represents determination and mental clarity, it also warns against recklessness or impulsive behavior. You are encouraged to think things through before rushing into a situation, as haste could lead to mistakes. The card urges you to maintain focus and direction, ensuring that your actions are aligned with your long-term goals.

reversed.keywords: Impulsiveness, impatience, recklessness, scattered energy.
reversed.advice: Slow down and think before acting. Impulsiveness may lead to mistakes or setbacks.
reversed.description: The Knight of Swords reversed warns against impulsiveness and reckless behavior. You may be feeling impatient or eager to take action, but this card advises caution. Rushing into a situation without proper planning or forethought could lead to mistakes or conflicts. The reversal also suggests that your energy may be scattered, making it difficult to stay focused on your goals. This card encourages you to slow down, think things through, and ensure that your actions are deliberate and well-considered.

uprigth.keywords: Directness, action, determination, impatience.
uprigth.advice: Be direct and take action in your love life, but be mindful of rushing into decisions without considering the consequences.
uprigth.description: The Knight of Swords is a card of swift action and determination in love. You or your partner may be eager to move forward and make things happen, but this card warns against being too impulsive. While direct communication and decisiveness are important, it’s equally important to consider the impact of your actions on the relationship. For singles, this card suggests that someone may come into your life quickly and with great intensity, but you should ensure that things don’t move too fast without careful thought.

reversed.keywords: Recklessness, impatience, lack of direction.
reversed.advice: Avoid rushing into decisions or acting impulsively. Take time to reflect and plan before moving forward.
reversed.description: The reversed Knight of Swords warns of recklessness and impatience in love. You or your partner may be acting impulsively or without considering the consequences, leading to confusion or conflict. This card encourages you to slow down and avoid making rash decisions that could harm the relationship. For singles, it suggests that you may be rushing into a romantic situation without fully understanding the other person’s intentions, and it’s important to take your time before committing.

name: Queen of Swords (Card 13 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Independence, clarity, objectivity, intellect, fairness.
uprigth.advice: Approach situations with logic and clarity. Be fair and objective, but also maintain healthy emotional boundaries.
uprigth.description: The Queen of Swords represents clarity of thought, independence, and keen perception. She is wise, logical, and not easily swayed by emotions. This card suggests that you may need to make decisions based on logic rather than emotion, staying objective and clear-headed. The Queen of Swords encourages you to set strong boundaries, communicate directly, and make choices with fairness and discernment. While she values intellect and truth, she also understands the need to protect her heart and remain impartial in emotionally charged situations.

reversed.keywords: Coldness, bitterness, overly critical, emotional distance.
reversed.advice: Be mindful of becoming too detached or critical. While logic is important, don’t dismiss the emotional aspect of situations.
reversed.description: The Queen of Swords reversed warns against becoming overly cold or emotionally distant. While objectivity and logic are valuable, this card suggests that you may be neglecting your emotional side or shutting others out. The reversal also points to being overly critical, judgmental, or harsh in your approach. It encourages you to find balance—while it’s important to remain clear-headed, don’t lose sight of empathy and compassion. If you’ve been hurt in the past, the Queen of Swords reversed may also indicate the need to heal from bitterness or resentment

uprigth.keywords: Independence, clear boundaries, intellect, honesty.
uprigth.advice: Be honest and direct in your communication. Maintain healthy boundaries while nurturing emotional connection.
uprigth.description: The Queen of Swords represents clarity, independence, and intellectual strength in love. You or your partner may be focused on maintaining healthy boundaries and valuing honesty above all. This card encourages you to approach your relationship with maturity, clear communication, and mutual respect. For singles, the Queen of Swords suggests that you may be seeking a partner who values intelligence and emotional independence, and you are not afraid to set clear expectations in your romantic life.

reversed.keywords: Coldness, emotional detachment, harsh words.
reversed.advice: Be mindful of being too harsh or emotionally distant. Reconnect with your softer side and show compassion.
reversed.description: The reversed Queen of Swords warns of emotional detachment or coldness in love. You or your partner may be using logic as a defense mechanism, shutting down emotional connection in favor of intellectual distance. This card encourages you to soften your approach and allow yourself to be more vulnerable and compassionate. For singles, it suggests that you may be pushing people away with a harsh or overly critical attitude, and it’s time to open up emotionally to foster deeper connections.

name: King of Swords (Card 14 in the Swords)

uprigth.keywords: Authority, intellect, leadership, truth, logic, integrity.
uprigth.advice: Lead with clarity and integrity. Use your intellect and knowledge to make informed, fair decisions.
uprigth.description: The King of Swords represents authority, wisdom, and clarity of thought. He is a leader who values truth, justice, and logic above all else. This card suggests that you are in a position to take charge or make important decisions, and it encourages you to use your intellect and experience to do so. The King of Swords advises being objective, clear, and ethical in your approach to situations, ensuring that your decisions are fair and based on facts. He also signifies someone who commands respect through their knowledge and integrity.

reversed.keywords: Manipulation, tyranny, misuse of power, dishonesty, ruthlessness.
reversed.advice: Be careful not to misuse your authority or manipulate situations. Maintain integrity, and avoid being overly harsh or controlling.
reversed.description: The King of Swords reversed warns of the misuse of power, manipulation, or a lack of integrity. You may be using your intellect or position of authority in a way that is unfair, dishonest, or overly controlling. The reversal suggests that you could be acting with ruthlessness or coldness, neglecting the impact of your actions on others. This card encourages you to reassess your approach, ensuring that you are acting ethically and fairly. If you are dealing with someone in a position of authority, the King of Swords reversed may also signify that they are using their power in a harmful or manipulative way.

uprigth.keywords: Authority, clear thinking, truth, discipline.
uprigth.advice: Approach your relationship with clear communication and fairness. Balance logic with emotional understanding.
uprigth.description: The King of Swords represents authority, intellect, and fairness in love. You or your partner may take a logical, disciplined approach to the relationship, seeking to maintain clear communication and mutual respect. This card encourages you to lead with clarity and honesty, ensuring that decisions are made with fairness. For singles, the King of Swords suggests that you are looking for someone who is mature, intellectual, and values truth and integrity in relationships.

reversed.keywords: Manipulation, cold authority, misuse of power.
reversed.advice: Avoid using intellect or authority to control the relationship. Lead with empathy and mutual respect.
reversed.description: The reversed King of Swords warns of manipulation or misuse of power in love. You or your partner may be using intellect or authority to control the relationship, leading to emotional distance or imbalance. This card encourages you to avoid being overly critical or controlling and to foster a relationship based on mutual understanding and compassion. For singles, it suggests that you may be encountering someone who uses their intellect or status to manipulate situations, and you should proceed with caution.

name: Ace of Cups (Card 1 in the Cups)

uprigth.keywords: New relationships, emotional fulfillment, love, compassion, creativity.
uprigth.advice: Embrace new emotional experiences and opportunities for love. Let your heart guide you and express your feelings openly.
uprigth.description: The Ace of Cups signifies new beginnings in emotional experiences, relationships, and love. This card often marks the start of a new romance, a deepening of a current relationship, or a surge of creativity and inspiration. It represents emotional fulfillment, happiness, and the outpouring of love and compassion. The Ace of Cups encourages you to open your heart to new possibilities and to be receptive to the love and emotional connections around you. This card suggests that you are about to enter a period of emotional abundance, where love, joy, and contentment flow freely.

reversed.keywords: Emotional blockage, suppressed feelings, loss of love, emptiness.
reversed.advice: Reflect on any emotional blockages or repressed feelings. Address them to heal and open yourself up to love again.
reversed.description: The Ace of Cups reversed suggests that you may be experiencing emotional blockages or difficulties in expressing your feelings. You could be holding back from fully engaging in a relationship, or there may be unresolved emotional pain that is preventing you from moving forward. This card encourages you to examine any emotional wounds or repressed feelings that need to be released. The reversal can also indicate a loss of emotional fulfillment, such as feeling disconnected from loved ones or lacking joy in your life. It’s a reminder to work on healing and reconnecting with your emotional self.

uprigth.keywords: New love, emotional fulfillment, joy, compassion.
uprigth.advice: Open your heart to new possibilities. Allow yourself to experience deep emotional connections.
uprigth.description: The Ace of Cups represents the start of a new emotional journey, often signaling new love or the deepening of an existing relationship. This card encourages you to open your heart fully, embrace vulnerability, and let love flow freely. It suggests emotional fulfillment, joy, and a sense of connection with a partner. For singles, the Ace of Cups indicates the potential for new romantic opportunities or an invitation to connect on a deeper level with someone special.

reversed.keywords: Emotional blockage, withheld feelings, sadness.
reversed.advice: Let go of emotional barriers and allow healing. Don't suppress your emotions.
reversed.description: The reversed Ace of Cups signals emotional blockages or a reluctance to open up in love. You may be holding back your feelings, creating distance between you and your partner. This card encourages you to address any unresolved emotional issues and allow yourself to heal. For singles, it suggests that you may be closed off to new romantic opportunities, and it's time to confront any emotional baggage that is holding you back from love.

name: Two of Cups (Card 2 in the Cups)

uprigth.keywords: Partnership, mutual attraction, unity, love, harmony.
uprigth.advice: Nurture your relationships and work towards deeper connection and harmony. Mutual respect and balance are key.
uprigth.description: The Two of Cups symbolizes harmonious relationships, partnerships, and mutual attraction. This card often represents romantic love, but it can also signify close friendships or professional partnerships based on mutual respect and support. It suggests that you are entering into or strengthening a relationship built on trust, balance, and equality. The Two of Cups encourages you to work on maintaining harmony in your relationships, ensuring that there is open communication, mutual respect, and a deep emotional bond. This is a card of love, unity, and shared connection.

reversed.keywords: Disconnection, imbalance, disharmony, conflict in relationships.
reversed.advice: Address any imbalances or conflicts in your relationships. Communication and compromise are essential to restoring harmony.
reversed.description: The Two of Cups reversed indicates disharmony or disconnection in a relationship. You may be experiencing conflict, misunderstandings, or a lack of emotional balance with someone important in your life. The reversal suggests that one person may be giving more than they are receiving, leading to feelings of frustration or resentment. This card encourages you to address any issues in the relationship through open communication and compromise. It may also indicate that a relationship is not meant to last, and you need to assess whether it’s worth continuing.

uprigth.keywords: Partnership, harmony, attraction, mutual respect.
uprigth.advice: Nurture the balance and harmony in your relationship. Focus on mutual respect and shared values.
uprigth.description: The Two of Cups signifies a strong partnership based on mutual respect, love, and emotional balance. This card indicates a deep emotional connection with a partner where both parties are equally invested in the relationship. It often represents the beginning of a romantic partnership or the strengthening of an existing bond. For singles, the Two of Cups suggests that a harmonious, balanced relationship may be on the horizon, bringing with it mutual attraction and emotional fulfillment.

reversed.keywords: Imbalance, disharmony, conflict.
reversed.advice: Address any relationship issues directly. Work together to restore harmony and balance.
reversed.description: The reversed Two of Cups warns of imbalance or disharmony in a relationship. There may be conflicts, miscommunication, or an unequal emotional investment from one partner. This card encourages you to address these issues openly and honestly, working together to restore balance and mutual respect. For singles, it suggests that a potential relationship may be off-balance, and it’s important to ensure that both parties are equally committed before moving forward.

name: Three of Cups (Card 3 in the Cups)

uprigth.keywords: Celebration, friendship, community, joy, social gatherings.
uprigth.advice: Take time to celebrate with friends and loved ones. Strengthen your connections with those who bring you joy and support.
uprigth.description: The Three of Cups represents celebration, friendship, and community. This card suggests that you are surrounded by people who support and uplift you, and it’s a time to come together in joy and camaraderie. The Three of Cups encourages you to enjoy life’s pleasures and celebrate your achievements with those closest to you. It often appears when you are invited to social gatherings, parties, or celebrations. This card also signifies emotional support from your social circle and reminds you to cherish the connections you have with friends and loved ones.

reversed.keywords: Overindulgence, isolation, lack of support, disharmony.
reversed.advice: Reflect on any feelings of isolation or disconnect. Reach out to friends or loved ones to rebuild emotional support.
reversed.description: The Three of Cups reversed suggests that you may be feeling isolated or disconnected from your social circle. You might be withdrawing from friends or lacking emotional support. This card advises you to reflect on whether you have been overindulging in social activities or neglecting deeper emotional connections. The reversal may also indicate conflicts or disharmony within a group of friends or loved ones, leading to feelings of loneliness or alienation. It’s important to address any misunderstandings and reconnect with those who support and care for you.

uprigth.keywords: Celebration, friendship, joy, social connection.
uprigth.advice: Embrace the joy of love and friendship. Celebrate your relationship and the connections you’ve built.
uprigth.description: The Three of Cups represents celebration and joy within relationships. It suggests that love and happiness are shared not just between partners but also with friends and family. This card can symbolize engagement, marriage, or joyful gatherings that enhance your romantic connection. For singles, the Three of Cups indicates a time of social enjoyment, where you may meet someone special through friends or group activities.

reversed.keywords: Isolation, third-party interference, disconnection.
reversed.advice: Avoid gossip and outside interference. Focus on strengthening your relationship’s emotional bond.
reversed.description: The reversed Three of Cups warns of possible third-party interference or emotional disconnection in a relationship. This could suggest a lack of support from friends or family or feeling isolated within the relationship itself. The card encourages you to be cautious of external influences and prioritize honest communication with your partner. For singles, it suggests avoiding relationships that may involve third parties or emotional complications.

name: Four of Cups (Card 4 in the Cups)

uprigth.keywords: Contemplation, apathy, discontent, reevaluation, missed opportunities.
uprigth.advice: Take time to reflect on your emotions and current situation. Don’t let apathy or discontent blind you to opportunities.
uprigth.description: The Four of Cups indicates a period of introspection, contemplation, or discontent. You may be feeling emotionally unfulfilled, disconnected, or apathetic towards the opportunities around you. This card suggests that you are focused on what is lacking in your life, rather than appreciating what is being offered to you. The Four of Cups encourages you to take time for self-reflection, but also to remain open to new possibilities. There may be an opportunity for emotional growth or fulfillment that you are not seeing because of your current mindset.

reversed.keywords: Awareness, acceptance, new opportunities, emotional reawakening.
reversed.advice: Open yourself up to new opportunities and emotional experiences. It’s time to let go of apathy and embrace what life has to offer.
reversed.description: The Four of Cups reversed suggests that you are beginning to move out of a period of emotional discontent or apathy. After a time of introspection or withdrawal, you are ready to embrace new opportunities and experiences. This card signifies an emotional reawakening, where you are more aware of the possibilities around you and are willing to take action. The reversal encourages you to let go of any feelings of stagnation or dissatisfaction and to focus on the positive aspects of your life. It’s a time to open your heart to new connections and emotional fulfillment.

uprigth.keywords: Apathy, dissatisfaction, emotional reevaluation.
uprigth.advice: Take time to reflect on your emotional state. Don’t close yourself off to love out of fear or dissatisfaction.
uprigth.description: The Four of Cups represents emotional dissatisfaction or apathy in love. You or your partner may be feeling disconnected, bored, or unfulfilled in the relationship. This card encourages you to reflect on what you truly want in a relationship and to be open to new possibilities that may come your way. For singles, the Four of Cups suggests that you may be missing romantic opportunities because of emotional detachment or dissatisfaction with your current state of love.

reversed.keywords: New interest, emotional breakthrough, awareness.
reversed.advice: Be open to new emotional experiences and healing. Let go of past hurts to make room for new love.
reversed.description: The reversed Four of Cups signifies a renewed interest in love and emotional connection. You may be ready to move past feelings of apathy or dissatisfaction and open yourself up to new emotional experiences. This card suggests a breakthrough in emotional awareness, where you are willing to embrace love and connection once again. For singles, it indicates that you are becoming more open to new romantic opportunities and ready to let go of emotional stagnation.

name: Five of Cups (Card 5 in the Cups)

uprigth.keywords: Loss, regret, grief, disappointment, focusing on the negative.
uprigth.advice: It’s important to acknowledge your feelings of loss or disappointment, but also to focus on what still remains and rebuild from there.
uprigth.description: The Five of Cups symbolizes loss, regret, and emotional pain. You may be focused on a situation where things didn’t turn out as expected, and you are grieving over what was lost. This card suggests that while it’s natural to feel sadness, you may be overly fixated on what went wrong rather than recognizing what is still salvageable. The Five of Cups encourages you to look around and see the remaining opportunities or relationships that still offer support and love. It’s a card of learning from emotional setbacks and eventually moving forward with hope.

reversed.keywords: Acceptance, moving on, healing, emotional recovery, optimism.
reversed.advice: You are ready to let go of past disappointments and embrace the healing process. It’s time to shift your focus toward the future.
reversed.description: The Five of Cups reversed indicates that you are in the process of emotional healing and recovery after a period of loss or regret. You may have finally come to terms with what has happened and are now ready to move forward with a renewed sense of hope. The reversal signifies that you are letting go of emotional baggage and starting to focus on rebuilding your life or relationships. It encourages optimism and the understanding that there is still something positive to be gained, even from difficult experiences.

uprigth.keywords: Regret, loss, disappointment, grief.
uprigth.advice: Acknowledge the pain of loss but don’t dwell on it. Healing comes when you look toward the future.
uprigth.description: The Five of Cups represents grief, loss, and emotional disappointment. You or your partner may be mourning a past relationship or regretting actions that led to emotional pain. This card suggests that while it’s important to acknowledge the sadness, it’s equally essential to focus on the possibilities that remain. For singles, this card may indicate a sense of regret over past love experiences, but it encourages you to look forward to new emotional connections rather than staying stuck in the past.

reversed.keywords: Acceptance, moving on, emotional healing.
reversed.advice: Release the pain of past losses. Focus on healing and the opportunities that lie ahead.
reversed.description: The reversed Five of Cups signals emotional recovery and the acceptance of past mistakes or heartbreak. You are beginning to let go of the emotional pain and disappointment, making way for healing and moving forward. In relationships, it indicates that you or your partner may be ready to forgive and release past hurt. For singles, it suggests that you are letting go of emotional baggage and are open to new relationships.

name: Six of Cups (Card 6 in the Cups)

uprigth.keywords: Nostalgia, childhood memories, innocence, joy, kindness.
uprigth.advice: Take time to connect with your past, whether through memories, people, or activities that bring joy and comfort. Embrace innocence and kindness.
uprigth.description: The Six of Cups represents nostalgia, memories of childhood, and the joy of simpler times. It often indicates reconnecting with your past, whether through old friends, family, or revisiting places that hold sentimental value. This card encourages you to embrace kindness, innocence, and joy, and to give and receive love openly. The Six of Cups also suggests that you may be reminiscing about a time when life felt more carefree, and it reminds you that happiness can be found in the present by reconnecting with those positive memories.

reversed.keywords: Stuck in the past, difficulty moving on, unrealistic nostalgia, healing old wounds.
reversed.advice: Reflect on whether you are holding on too tightly to the past. It may be time to let go and focus on living in the present.
reversed.description: The Six of Cups reversed suggests that you may be overly focused on the past, and it’s preventing you from moving forward. You could be clinging to memories, idealizing a time that is no longer relevant, or feeling stuck in a place of nostalgia. The reversal encourages you to work on healing any emotional wounds related to your past and to let go of unrealistic expectations about reliving those moments. It’s time to release the hold that the past has on you and start creating new memories and experiences in the present.

uprigth.keywords: Nostalgia, reunion, childhood memories, innocence.
uprigth.advice: Embrace the joy of reconnecting with the past but remain grounded in the present.
uprigth.description: The Six of Cups often represents nostalgia or the reemergence of past relationships.
